nl.inl.blacklab.search.grouping

Class HitProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.grouping.HitProperty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HitPropertyDocumentDecade, HitPropertyDocumentId, HitPropertyDocumentStoredField, HitPropertyHitText, HitPropertyLeftContext, HitPropertyMultiple, HitPropertyRightContext, HitPropertyWordLeft, HitPropertyWordRight

    public abstract class HitProperty
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>
    Abstract base class for a property of a hit, like document title, hit text, right context, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public abstract HitPropValue get(Hit result)

      • compare

        public abstract int compare(java.lang.Object a,
          java.lang.Object b)
        Compares two hits on this property. Note that we use Object as the type instead of Hit to save on run-time type checking. We know (slash hope :-) that this method is only ever called to compare Hits.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        a - first hit
        b - second hit
        Returns:
        0 if equal, negative if a < b, positive if a > b.

      • needsContext

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> needsContext()
        Retrieve context from which field(s) prior to sorting/grouping on this property?
        Returns:
        null if no context is required, the fieldnames otherwise

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()

      • setContextIndices

        public void setContextIndices(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> contextIndices)
        For HitProperties that need context, sets the context indices that correspond to the context(s) they need in the result set.
        Parameters:
        contextIndices - the indices, in the same order as reported by needsContext().
